official_title: A bill to amend title V of Public Law 96-550, designating the Chaco Culture Archaelogical Protection Sites, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1993 - Designates seven new outlying areas as Chaco Culture Archaeological Protection Sites associated with Chacoan Anasazi Indian culture in the San Juan Basin and surrounding areas of New Mexico and Colorado. Expands the boundaries and removes or reduces the acreage of certain existing Sites. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to assist the Navajo Nation in the protection and management of such Sites located on lands of the Navajos through a grant, contract, or cooperative agreement entered into pursuant to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend title V of Public Law 96-550, designating the Chaco Culture Archaelogical Protection Sites, and for other purposes.
